member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter
member.summary:
Provides filtering the query results based on document attributes.
When you use the AndAllFilters or OrAllFilters, filters you can use 2 layers under the first attribute filter. For example, you can use:
<AndAllFilters>
<OrAllFilters>
<EqualTo>
If you use more than 2 layers, you receive a ValidationException exception with the message "AttributeFilter cannot have a depth of more than 2."
If you use more than 10 attribute filters in a given list for AndAllFilters or OrAllFilters, you receive a ValidationException with the message "AttributeFilter cannot have a length of more than 10".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.AndAllFilters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AndAllFilters.
Performs a logical AND operation on all supplied filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.ContainsAll
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContainsAll.
Returns true when a document contains all of the specified document attributes. This filter is only applicable to StringListValue metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.ContainsAny
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContainsAny.
Returns true when a document contains any of the specified document attributes. This filter is only applicable to StringListValue metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.EqualsTo
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EqualsTo.
Performs an equals operation on two document attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.GreaterThan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GreaterThan.
Performs a greater than operation on two document attributes. Use with a document attribute of type Date or Long.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.GreaterThanOrEquals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GreaterThanOrEquals.
Performs a greater or equals than operation on two document attributes. Use with a document attribute of type Date or Long.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.LessThan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LessThan.
Performs a less than operation on two document attributes. Use with a document attribute of type Date or Long.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.LessThanOrEquals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LessThanOrEquals.
Performs a less than or equals operation on two document attributes. Use with a document attribute of type Date or Long.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.NotFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotFilter.
Performs a logical NOT operation on all supplied filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AttributeFilter.OrAllFilters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrAllFilters.
Performs a logical OR operation on all supplied filters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AuthenticationConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to websites that require user authentication.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.AuthenticationConfiguration.BasicAuthentication
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BasicAuthentication.
The list of configuration information that's required to connect to and crawl a website host using basic authentication credentials.
The list includes the name and port number of the website host.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BasicAuthenticationConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to websites that require basic user authentication.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BasicAuthenticationConfiguration.Credentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credentials.
Your secret ARN, which you can create in AWS Secrets Manager
You use a secret if basic authentication credentials are required to connect to a website. The secret stores your credentials of user name and password.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BasicAuthenticationConfiguration.Host
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Host.
The name of the website host you want to connect to using authentication credentials.
For example, the host name of https://a.example.com/page1.html is "a.example.com".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BasicAuthenticationConfiguration.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number of the website host you want to connect to using authentication credentials.
For example, the port for https://a.example.com/page1.html is 443, the standard port for HTTPS.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchDeleteDocument operation. Removes one or more documents from an index. The documents must have been added with the BatchPutDocument operation.
The documents are deleted asynchronously. You can see the progress of the deletion by using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to the processing of the batch are sent to you CloudWatch log.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest.DocumentIdList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentIdList.
One or more identifiers for documents to delete from the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index that contains the documents to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchDeleteDocument operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponse.FailedDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailedDocuments.
A list of documents that could not be removed from the index. Each entry contains an error message that indicates why the document couldn't be removed from the index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponseFailedDocument
member.summary: Provides information about documents that could not be removed from an index by the BatchDeleteDocument operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponseFailedDocument.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
The error code for why the document couldn't be removed from the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponseFailedDocument.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
An explanation for why the document couldn't be removed from the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentResponseFailedDocument.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the document that couldn't be removed from the index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation. Returns the indexing status for one or more documents submitted with the BatchPutDocument operation.
When you use the BatchPutDocument operation, documents are indexed asynchronously. You can use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to get the current status of a list of documents so that you can determine if they have been successfully indexed.
You can also use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to check the status of the BatchDeleteDocument operation. When a document is deleted from the index, Amazon Kendra returns NOT_FOUND as the status.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest.DocumentInfoList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentInfoList.
A list of DocumentInfo objects that identify the documents for which to get the status. You identify the documents by their document ID and optional attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index to add documents to. The index ID is returned by the CreateIndex operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponse.DocumentStatusList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentStatusList.
The status of documents. The status indicates if the document is waiting to be indexed, is in the process of indexing, has completed indexing, or failed indexing. If a document failed indexing, the status provides the reason why.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponse.Errors
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Errors.
A list of documents that Amazon Kendra couldn't get the status for. The list includes the ID of the document and the reason that the status couldn't be found.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponseError
member.summary: Provides a response when the status of a document could not be retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponseError.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The unique identifier of the document whose status could not be retrieved.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponseError.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
Indicates the source of the error.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusResponseError.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
States that the API could not get the status of a document. This could be because the request is not valid or there is a system error.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchPutDocument operation. Adds one or more documents to an index.
The BatchPutDocument operation enables you to ingest inline documents or a set of documents stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use this operation to ingest your text and unstructured text into an index, add custom attributes to the documents, and to attach an access control list to the documents added to the index.
The documents are indexed asynchronously. You can see the progress of the batch using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to processing the batch are sent to your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest.Documents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Documents.
One or more documents to add to the index.
Documents can include custom attributes. For example, 'DataSourceId' and 'DataSourceSyncJobId' are custom attributes that provide information on the synchronization of documents running on a data source. Note, 'DataSourceSyncJobId' could be an optional custom attribute as Amazon Kendra will use the ID of a running sync job.
Documents have the following file size limits.
5 MB total size for inline documents
50 MB total size for files from an S3 bucket
5 MB extracted text for any file
For more information about file size and transaction per second quotas, see Quotas.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index to add the documents to. You need to create the index first using the CreateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that is allowed to run the BatchPutDocument operation. For more information, see IAM Roles for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchPutDocument operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponse.FailedDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailedDocuments.
A list of documents that were not added to the index because the document failed a validation check. Each document contains an error message that indicates why the document couldn't be added to the index.
If there was an error adding a document to an index the error is reported in your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log. For more information, see Monitoring Amazon Kendra with Amazon CloudWatch Logs

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponseFailedDocument
member.summary: Provides information about a document that could not be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponseFailedDocument.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
The type of error that caused the document to fail to be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponseFailedDocument.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
A description of the reason why the document could not be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentResponseFailedDocument.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CapacityUnitsConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies capacity units configured for your enterprise edition index. You can add and remove capacity units to tune an index to your requirements.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CapacityUnitsConfiguration.QueryCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryCapacityUnits.
The amount of extra query capacity for an index and GetQuerySuggestions capacity.
A single extra capacity unit for an index provides 0.1 queries per second or approximately 8,000 queries per day.
GetQuerySuggestions capacity is five times the provisioned query capacity for an index, or the base capacity of 2.5 calls per second, whichever is higher. For example, the base capacity for an index is 0.1 queries per second, and GetQuerySuggestions capacity has a base of 2.5 calls per second. If you add another 0.1 queries per second to total 0.2 queries per second for an index, the GetQuerySuggestions capacity is 2.5 calls per second (higher than five times 0.2 queries per second).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CapacityUnitsConfiguration.StorageCapacityUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageCapacityUnits.
The amount of extra storage capacity for an index. A single capacity unit provides 30 GB of storage space or 100,000 documents, whichever is reached first.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClearQuerySuggestionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ClearQuerySuggestions operation. Clears existing query suggestions from an index.
This deletes existing suggestions only, not the queries in the query log. After you clear suggestions, Amazon Kendra learns new suggestions based on new queries added to the query log from the time you cleared suggestions. If you do not see any new suggestions, then please allow Amazon Kendra to collect enough queries to learn new suggestions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClearQuerySuggestionsRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to clear query suggestions from.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClearQuerySuggestionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ClearQuerySuggestions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClickFeedback.ResultId

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the attachment settings for the Confluence data source. Attachment settings are optional, if you don't specify settings attachments, Amazon Kendra won't index them.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentConfiguration.AttachmentFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentFieldMappings.
Defines how attachment metadata fields should be mapped to index fields. Before you can map a field, you must first create an index field with a matching type using the console or the UpdateIndex operation.
If you specify the AttachentFieldMappings parameter, you must specify at least one field mapping.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentConfiguration.CrawlAttachments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlAttachments.
Indicates whether Amazon Kendra indexes attachments to the pages and blogs in the Confluence data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentToIndexFieldMapping
member.summary:
Defines the mapping between a field in the Confluence data source to a Amazon Kendra index field.
You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentToIndexFieldMapping.DataSourceFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceFieldName.
The name of the field in the data source.
You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentToIndexFieldMapping.DateFieldFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFieldFormat.
The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceAttachmentToIndexFieldMapping.IndexFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexFieldName.
The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the blog settings for the Confluence data source. Blogs are always indexed unless filtered from the index by the ExclusionPatterns or InclusionPatterns fields in the ConfluenceConfiguration type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogConfiguration.BlogFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlogFieldMappings.
Defines how blog metadata fields should be mapped to index fields. Before you can map a field, you must first create an index field with a matching type using the console or the UpdateIndex operation.
If you specify the BlogFieldMappings parameter, you must specify at least one field mapping.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogToIndexFieldMapping
member.summary:
Defines the mapping between a blog field in the Confluence data source to a Amazon Kendra index field.
You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogToIndexFieldMapping.DataSourceFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceFieldName.
The name of the field in the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogToIndexFieldMapping.DateFieldFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFieldFormat.
The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceBlogToIndexFieldMapping.IndexFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexFieldName.
The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for data sources that connect to Confluence.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.AttachmentConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for indexing attachments to Confluence blogs and pages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.BlogConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlogConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for indexing Confluence blogs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns that apply to a URL on the Confluence server. An exclusion pattern can apply to a blog post, a page, a space, or an attachment. Items that match the pattern are excluded from the index. Items that don't match the pattern are included in the index. If a item matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, the item isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns that apply to a URL on the Confluence server. An inclusion pattern can apply to a blog post, a page, a space, or an attachment. Items that match the patterns are included in the index. Items that don't match the pattern are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the item isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.PageConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for indexing Confluence pages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the key/value pairs required to connect to your Confluence server. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
username - The user name or email address of a user with administrative privileges for the Confluence server.
password - The password associated with the user logging in to the Confluence server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.ServerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerUrl.
The URL of your Confluence instance. Use the full URL of the server. For example, https://server.example.com:port/. You can also use an IP address, for example, https://192.168.1.113/.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.SpaceConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpaceConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for indexing Confluence spaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.Version
member.summary:

Specifies the version of the Confluence installation that you are connecting to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:

Specifies the information for connecting to an Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the page settings for the Confluence data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageConfiguration.PageFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageFieldMappings.
Defines how page metadata fields should be mapped to index fields. Before you can map a field, you must first create an index field with a matching type using the console or the UpdateIndex operation.
If you specify the PageFieldMappings parameter, you must specify at least one field mapping.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageToIndexFieldMapping
member.summary:
Defines the mapping between a field in the Confluence data source to a Amazon Kendra index field.
You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageToIndexFieldMapping.DataSourceFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceFieldName.
The name of the field in the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageToIndexFieldMapping.DateFieldFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFieldFormat.
The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluencePageToIndexFieldMapping.IndexFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexFieldName.
The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration for indexing Confluence spaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration.CrawlArchivedSpaces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlArchivedSpaces.
Specifies whether Amazon Kendra should index archived spaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration.CrawlPersonalSpaces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlPersonalSpaces.
Specifies whether Amazon Kendra should index personal spaces. Users can add restrictions to items in personal spaces. If personal spaces are indexed, queries without user context information may return restricted items from a personal space in their results. For more information, see Filtering on user context.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration.ExcludeSpaces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeSpaces.
A list of space keys of Confluence spaces. If you include a key, the blogs, documents, and attachments in the space are not indexed. If a space is in both the ExcludeSpaces and the IncludeSpaces list, the space is excluded.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration.IncludeSpaces
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeSpaces.
A list of space keys for Confluence spaces. If you include a key, the blogs, documents, and attachments in the space are indexed. Spaces that aren't in the list aren't indexed. A space in the list must exist. Otherwise, Amazon Kendra logs an error when the data source is synchronized. If a space is in both the IncludeSpaces and the ExcludeSpaces list, the space is excluded.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceConfiguration.SpaceFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpaceFieldMappings.
Defines how space metadata fields should be mapped to index fields. Before you can map a field, you must first create an index field with a matching type using the console or the UpdateIndex operation.
If you specify the SpaceFieldMappings parameter, you must specify at least one field mapping.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceToIndexFieldMapping
member.summary:
Defines the mapping between a field in the Confluence data source to a Amazon Kendra index field.
You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceToIndexFieldMapping.DataSourceFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceFieldName.
The name of the field in the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceToIndexFieldMapping.DateFieldFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFieldFormat.
The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConfluenceSpaceToIndexFieldMapping.IndexFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexFieldName.
The name of the index field to map to the Confluence data source field. The index field type must match the Confluence field type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration.DatabaseHost
member.summary:

The name of the host for the database. Can be either a string (host.subdomain.domain.tld) or an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
The name of the database containing the document data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration.DatabasePort
member.summary:

The port that the database uses for connections.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of credentials stored in Secrets Manager. The credentials should be a user/password pair. For more information, see Using a Database Data Source. For more information about Secrets Manager, see What Is Secrets Manager in the Secrets Manager user guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ConnectionConfiguration.TableName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TableName.
The name of the table that contains the document data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateDataSource operation. Creates a data source that you want to use with an Amazon Kendra index.
You specify a name, data source connector type and description for your data source. You also specify configuration information for the data source connector.
CreateDataSource is a synchronous operation. The operation returns 200 if the data source was successfully created. Otherwise, an exception is raised.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A token that you provide to identify the request to create a data source. Multiple calls to the CreateDataSource operation with the same client token will create only one data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The connector configuration information that is required to access the repository.
You can't specify the Configuration parameter when the Type parameter is set to CUSTOM. If you do, you receive a ValidationException exception.
The Configuration parameter is required for all other data sources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description for the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index that should be associated with this data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The code for a language. This allows you to support a language for all documents when creating the data source. English is supported by default. For more information on supported languages, including their codes, see Adding documents in languages other than English.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A unique name for the data source. A data source name can't be changed without deleting and recreating the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to access the data source. For more information, see IAM Roles for Amazon Kendra.
You can't specify the RoleArn parameter when the Type parameter is set to CUSTOM. If you do, you receive a ValidationException exception.
The RoleArn parameter is required for all other data sources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Schedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedule.
Sets the frequency that Amazon Kendra will check the documents in your repository and update the index. If you don't set a schedule Amazon Kendra will not periodically update the index. You can call the StartDataSourceSyncJob operation to update the index.
You can't specify the Schedule parameter when the Type parameter is set to CUSTOM. If you do, you receive a ValidationException exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of key-value pairs that identify the data source. You can use the tags to identify and organize your resources and to control access to resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of repository that contains the data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateDataSource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
A unique identifier for the data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateFaq operation. Creates an new set of frequently asked question (FAQ) questions and answers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A token that you provide to identify the request to create a FAQ. Multiple calls to the CreateFaqRequest operation with the same client token will create only one FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.FileFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileFormat.
The format of the input file. You can choose between a basic CSV format, a CSV format that includes customs attributes in a header, and a JSON format that includes custom attributes.
The format must match the format of the file stored in the S3 bucket identified in the S3Path parameter.
For more information, see Adding questions and answers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index that contains the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The code for a language. This allows you to support a language for the FAQ document. English is supported by default. For more information on supported languages, including their codes, see Adding documents in languages other than English.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name that should be associated with the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to access the S3 bucket that contains the FAQs. For more information, see IAM Roles for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.S3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Path.
The S3 location of the FAQ input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of key-value pairs that identify the FAQ. You can use the tags to identify and organize your resources and to control access to resources.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateFaq operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateFaqResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the FAQ.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateIndex operation. Creates a new Amazon Kendra index. Index creation is an asynchronous operation. To determine if index creation has completed, check the Status field returned from a call to DescribeIndex. The Status field is set to ACTIVE when the index is ready to use.
Once the index is active you can index your documents using the BatchPutDocument operation or using one of the supported data sources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A token that you provide to identify the request to create an index. Multiple calls to the CreateIndex operation with the same client token will create only one index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description for the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.Edition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Edition.
The Amazon Kendra edition to use for the index. Choose DEVELOPER_EDITION for indexes intended for development, testing, or proof of concept. Use ENTERPRISE_EDITION for your production databases. Once you set the edition for an index, it can't be changed.
The Edition parameter is optional. If you don't supply a value, the default is ENTERPRISE_EDITION.
For more information on quota limits for enterprise and developer editions, see Quotas.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name for the new index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
An Identity and Access Management(IAM) role that gives Amazon Kendra permissions to access your Amazon CloudWatch logs and metrics. This is also the role used when you use the BatchPutDocument operation to index documents from an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration.
The identifier of the KMScustomer managed key (CMK) to use to encrypt data indexed by Amazon Kendra. Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric CMKs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of key-value pairs that identify the index. You can use the tags to identify and organize your resources and to control access to resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.UserContextPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserContextPolicy.
The user context policy.
ATTRIBUTE_FILTER
All indexed content is searchable and displayable for all users. If you want to filter search results on user context, you can use the attribute filters of _user_id and _group_ids or you can provide user and group information in UserContext.
USER_TOKEN
Enables token-based user access control to filter search results on user context. All documents with no access control and all documents accessible to the user will be searchable and displayable.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.UserGroupResolutionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserGroupResolutionConfiguration.
Enables fetching access levels of groups and users from an AWS Single Sign-On identity source. To configure this, see UserGroupResolutionConfiguration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest.UserTokenConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserTokenConfigurations.
The user token configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the index. Use this identifier when you query an index, set up a data source, or index a document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation. Creates a block list to exlcude certain queries from suggestions.
Any query that contains words or phrases specified in the block list is blocked or filtered out from being shown as a suggestion.
You need to provide the file location of your block list text file in your S3 bucket. In your text file, enter each block word or phrase on a separate line.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A token that you provide to identify the request to create a query suggestions block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A user-friendly description for the block list.
For example, the description "List of all offensive words that can appear in user queries and need to be blocked from suggestions."

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to create a query suggestions block list for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A user friendly name for the block list.
For example, the block list named 'offensive-words' includes all offensive words that could appear in user queries and need to be blocked from suggestions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The IAM (Identity and Access Management) role used by Amazon Kendra to access the block list text file in your S3 bucket.
You need permissions to the role ARN (Amazon Resource Name). The role needs S3 read permissions to your file in S3 and needs to give STS (Security Token Service) assume role permissions to Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.SourceS3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceS3Path.
The S3 path to your block list text file in your S3 bucket.
Each block word or phrase should be on a separate line in a text file.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A tag that you can assign to a block list that categorizes the block list.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the created block list.

member.summary:

The name for the new thesaurus.

member.summary:

An AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that gives Amazon Kendra permissions to access thesaurus file specified in SourceS3Path.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.ExecutionId

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
Maps a batch delete document request to a specific data source sync job. This is optional and should only be supplied when documents are deleted by a data source connector.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The execution status of the synchronization job. When the Status field is set to SUCCEEDED, the synchronization job is done. If the status code is set to FAILED, the ErrorCode and ErrorMessage fields give you the reason for the failure.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics
member.summary: Maps a batch delete document request to a specific data source sync job. This is optional and should only be supplied when documents are deleted by a data source connector.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsAdded
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsDeleted
member.summary:

member.summary: Maps a particular data source sync job to a particular data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The ID of the data source that is running the sync job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget.DataSourceSyncJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceSyncJobId.
The ID of the sync job that is running on the data source.
If the ID of a sync job is not provided and there is a sync job running, then the ID of this sync job is used and metrics are generated for this sync job.
If the ID of a sync job is not provided and there is no sync job running, then no metrics are generated and documents are indexed/deleted at the index level without sync job metrics included.

While the data source is being deleted, the Status field returned by a call to the DescribeDataSource operation is set to DELETING. For more information, see Deleting Data Sources.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeletePrincipalMapping operation. Deletes a group so that all users and sub groups that belong to the group can no longer access documents only available to that group.
For example, after deleting the group "Summer Interns", all interns who belonged to that group no longer see intern-only documents in their search results.
If you want to delete or replace users or sub groups of a group, you need to use the PutPrincipalMapping operation. For example, if a user in the group "Engineering" leaves the engineering team and another user takes their place, you provide an updated list of users or sub groups that belong to the "Engineering" group when calling PutPrincipalMapping. You can update your internal list of users or sub groups and input this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source you want to delete a group from.
This is useful if a group is tied to multiple data sources and you want to delete a group from accessing documents in a certain data source. For example, the groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" are all tied to the company's documents stored in the data sources Confluence and Salesforce. You want to delete "Research" and "Engineering" groups from Salesforce, so that these groups cannot access customer-related documents stored in Salesforce. Only "Sales and Marketing" should access documents in the Salesforce data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to delete a group from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The timestamp identifier you specify to ensure Amazon Kendra does not override the latest DELETE action with previous actions. The highest number ID, which is the ordering ID, is the latest action you want to process and apply on top of other actions with lower number IDs. This prevents previous actions with lower number IDs from possibly overriding the latest action.
The ordering ID can be the UNIX time of the last update you made to a group members list. You would then provide this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping. This ensures your DELETE action for that updated group with the latest members list doesn't get overwritten by earlier DELETE actions for the same group which are yet to be processed.
The default ordering ID is the current UNIX time in milliseconds that the action was received by Amazon Kendra.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeletePrincipalMapping operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation. Deletes a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
A deleted block list might not take effect right away. Amazon Kendra needs to refresh the entire suggestions list to add back the queries that were previously blocked.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of the block list that needs to be deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the you want to delete a block list from.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation.

This includes information on the status of actions currently processing or yet to be processed, when actions were last updated, when actions were received by Amazon Kendra, the latest action that should process and apply after other actions, and useful error messages if an action could not be processed.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index required to check the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribePrincipalMapping operation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
Shows the identifier of the group to see information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.GroupOrderingIdSummaries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupOrderingIdSummaries.
Shows the following information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups:
Status the status can be either PROCESSING, SUCCEEDED, DELETING, DELETED, or FAILED.
Last updated the last date-time an action was updated.
Received the last date-time an action was received or submitted.
Ordering ID the latest action that should process and apply after other actions.
Failure reason the reason an action could not be processed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.IndexId
member.summary:

Shows the identifier of the index to see information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.summary:

Shows whether Amazon Kendra uses all queries or only uses queries that include user information to generate query suggestions.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastClearTime.
Shows the date-time query suggestions for an index was last cleared.
After you clear suggestions, Amazon Kendra learns new suggestions based on new queries added to the query log from the time you cleared suggestions. Amazon Kendra only considers re-occurences of a query from the time you cleared suggestions.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Shows whether query suggestions are currently in ENABLED mode or LEARN_ONLY mode.
By default, Amazon Kendra enables query suggestions.LEARN_ONLY turns off query suggestions for your users. You can change the mode using the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.QueryLogLookBackWindowInDays
member.summary:

Shows how recent your queries are in your query log time window (in days).

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Shows whether the status of query suggestions settings is currently Active or Updating.
Active means the current settings apply and Updating means your changed settings are in the process of applying.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalSuggestionsCount.
Shows the current total count of query suggestions for an index.
This count can change when you update your query suggestions settings, if you filter out certain queries from suggestions using a block list, and as the query log accumulates more queries for Amazon Kendra to learn from.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the thesaurus. When the value is ACTIVE, queries are able to use the thesaurus. If the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field provides more information.
If the status is ACTIVE_BUT_UPDATE_FAILED, it means that Amazon Kendra could not ingest the new thesaurus file. The old thesaurus file is still active.

Documents passed to the Blob parameter must be base64 encoded. Your code might not need to encode the document file bytes if you're using an Amazon Web Services SDK to call Amazon Kendra operations. It is important for the time zone to be included in the ISO 8601 date-time format. For example, 20120325T123010+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentInfo.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
Attributes that identify a specific version of a document to check.
The only valid attributes are:
version
datasourceId
jobExecutionId
The attributes follow these rules:
dataSourceId and jobExecutionId must be used together.
version is ignored if dataSourceId and jobExecutionId are not provided.
If dataSourceId and jobExecutionId are provided, but version is not, the version defaults to "0".

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetQuerySuggestions operation. Fetches the queries that are suggested to your users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to get query suggestions from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.MaxSuggestionsCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxSuggestionsCount.
The maximum number of query suggestions you want to show to your users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.QueryText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryText.
The text of a user's query to generate query suggestions.
A query is suggested if the query prefix matches what a user starts to type as their query.
Amazon Kendra does not show any suggestions if a user types fewer than two characters or more than 60 characters. A query must also have at least one search result and contain at least one word of more than four characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetQuerySuggestions operation.

The unique identifier for a list of query suggestions for an index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsResponse.Suggestions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Suggestions.
A list of query suggestions for an index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for data sources that connect to Google Drive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeMimeTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeMimeTypes.
A list of MIME types to exclude from the index. All documents matching the specified MIME type are excluded.
For a list of MIME types, see Using a Google Workspace Drive data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeSharedDrives
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeSharedDrives.
A list of identifiers or shared drives to exclude from the index. All files and folders stored on the shared drive are excluded.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeUserAccounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeUserAccounts.
A list of email addresses of the users. Documents owned by these users are excluded from the index. Documents shared with excluded users are indexed unless they are excluded in another way.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns that apply to the path on Google Drive. Items that match the pattern are excluded from the index from both shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that don't match the pattern are included in the index. If an item matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, it is excluded from the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
Defines mapping between a field in the Google Drive and a Amazon Kendra index field.
If you are using the console, you can define index fields when creating the mapping. If you are using the API, you must first create the field using the UpdateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns that apply to path on Google Drive. Items that match the pattern are included in the index from both shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that don't match the pattern are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, it is excluded from the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Secrets Managersecret that contains the credentials required to connect to Google Drive. For more information, see Using a Google Workspace Drive data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers
member.summary: A list of users or sub groups that belong to a group. Users and groups are useful for filtering search results to different users based on their group's access to documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.MemberGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberGroups.
A list of sub groups that belong to a group. For example, the sub groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" all belong to the group "Company".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.MemberUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberUsers.
A list of users that belong to a group. For example, a list of interns all belong to the "Interns" group.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.S3PathforGroupMembers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3PathforGroupMembers.
If you have more than 1000 users and/or sub groups for a single group, you need to provide the path to the S3 file that lists your users and sub groups for a group. Your sub groups can contain more than 1000 users, but the list of sub groups that belong to a group (and/or users) must be no more than 1000.
You can download this example S3 file that uses the correct format for listing group members. Note, dataSourceId is optional. The value of type for a group is always GROUP and for a user it is always USER.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.LastUpdatedAt
member.summary:

The last date-time an action was updated. An action can be a PUT or DELETE action for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.OrderingId
member.summary:

The current processing status of actions for mapping users to their groups. The status can be either PROCESSING, SUCCEEDED, DELETING, DELETED, or FAILED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for data sources that connect to OneDrive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.DisableLocalGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisableLocalGroups.
A Boolean value that specifies whether local groups are disabled (True) or enabled (False).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
List of regular expressions applied to documents. Items that match the exclusion pattern are not indexed. If you provide both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, any item that matches the exclusion pattern isn't indexed.
The exclusion pattern is applied to the file name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map Microsoft OneDrive fields to custom fields in the Amazon Kendra index. You must first create the index fields before you map OneDrive fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the pattern are included in the index. Documents that don't match the pattern are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The exclusion pattern is applied to the file name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.OneDriveUsers

Gets and sets the property OneDriveUsers.
A list of user accounts whose documents should be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the user name and password to connect to OneDrive. The user namd should be the application ID for the OneDrive application, and the password is the application key for the OneDrive application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.TenantDomain

The Azure Active Directory domain of the organization.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveUsers
member.summary: User accounts whose documents should be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveUsers.OneDriveUserList
member.summary:

A list of users whose documents should be indexed. Specify the user names in email format, for example, username@tenantdomain. If you need to index the documents of more than 100 users, use the OneDriveUserS3Path field to specify the location of a file containing a list of users.

The S3 bucket location of a file containing a list of users whose documents should be indexed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for a web proxy to connect to website hosts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Credentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credentials.
Your secret ARN, which you can create in AWS Secrets Manager
The credentials are optional. You use a secret if web proxy credentials are required to connect to a website host. Amazon Kendra currently support basic authentication to connect to a web proxy server. The secret stores your credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Host
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Host.
The name of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.
For example, the host name of https://a.example.com/page1.html is "a.example.com".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.
For example, the port for https://a.example.com/page1.html is 443, the standard port for HTTPS.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutPrincipalMapping operation. Maps users to their groups so that you only need to provide the user ID when you issue the query.
You can also map sub groups to groups. For example, the group "Company Intellectual Property Teams" includes sub groups "Research" and "Engineering". These sub groups include their own list of users or people who work in these teams. Only users who work in research and engineering, and therefore belong in the intellectual property group, can see top-secret company documents in their search results.
You map users to their groups when you want to filter search results for different users based on their groups access to documents. For more information on filtering search results for different users, see Filtering on user context.
If more than five PUT actions for a group are currently processing, a validation exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source you want to map users to their groups.
This is useful if a group is tied to multiple data sources, but you only want the group to access documents of a certain data source. For example, the groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" are all tied to the company's documents stored in the data sources Confluence and Salesforce. However, "Sales and Marketing" team only needs access to customer-related documents stored in Salesforce.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group you want to map its users to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.GroupMembers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupMembers.
The list that contains your users or sub groups that belong the same group.
For example, the group "Company" includes the user "CEO" and the sub groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing".
If you have more than 1000 users and/or sub groups for a single group, you need to provide the path to the S3 file that lists your users and sub groups for a group. Your sub groups can contain more than 1000 users, but the list of sub groups that belong to a group (and/or users) must be no more than 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to map users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The timestamp identifier you specify to ensure Amazon Kendra does not override the latest PUT action with previous actions. The highest number ID, which is the ordering ID, is the latest action you want to process and apply on top of other actions with lower number IDs. This prevents previous actions with lower number IDs from possibly overriding the latest action.
The ordering ID can be the UNIX time of the last update you made to a group members list. You would then provide this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping. This ensures your PUT action for that updated group with the latest members list doesn't get overwritten by earlier PUT actions for the same group which are yet to be processed.
The default ordering ID is the current UNIX time in milliseconds that the action was received by Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3 file that contains your list of users or sub groups that belong to a group.
For more information, see IAM roles for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutPrincipalMapping operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the Query operation. Searches an active index. Use this API to search your documents using query. The Query operation enables to do faceted search and to filter results based on document attributes.
It also enables you to provide user context that Amazon Kendra uses to enforce document access control in the search results.
Amazon Kendra searches your index for text content and question and answer (FAQ) content. By default the response contains three types of results.
Relevant passages
Matching FAQs
Relevant documents
You can specify that the query return only one type of result using the QueryResultTypeConfig parameter.
Each query returns the 100 most relevant results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.AttributeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeFilter.
Enables filtered searches based on document attributes. You can only provide one attribute filter; however, the AndAllFilters, NotFilter, and OrAllFilters parameters contain a list of other filters.
The AttributeFilter parameter enables you to create a set of filtering rules that a document must satisfy to be included in the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations.
Overrides relevance tuning configurations of fields or attributes set at the index level.
If you use this API to override the relevance tuning configured at the index level, but there is no relevance tuning configured at the index level, then Amazon Kendra does not apply any relevance tuning.
If there is relevance tuning configured at the index level, but you do not use this API to override any relevance tuning in the index, then Amazon Kendra uses the relevance tuning that is configured at the index level.
If there is relevance tuning configured for fields at the index level, but you use this API to override only some of these fields, then for the fields you did not override, the importance is set to 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.Facets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Facets.
An array of documents attributes. Amazon Kendra returns a count for each attribute key specified. You can use this information to help narrow the search for your user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The unique identifier of the index to search. The identifier is returned in the response from the CreateIndex operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.PageNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageNumber.
Query results are returned in pages the size of the PageSize parameter. By default, Amazon Kendra returns the first page of results. Use this parameter to get result pages after the first one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
Sets the number of results that are returned in each page of results. The default page size is 10. The maximum number of results returned is 100. If you ask for more than 100 results, only 100 are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.QueryResultTypeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryResultTypeFilter.
Sets the type of query. Only results for the specified query type are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.QueryText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryText.
The text to search for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.RequestedDocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedDocumentAttributes.
An array of document attributes to include in the response. No other document attributes are included in the response. By default all document attributes are included in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.SortingConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortingConfiguration.
Provides information that determines how the results of the query are sorted. You can set the field that Amazon Kendra should sort the results on, and specify whether the results should be sorted in ascending or descending order. In the case of ties in sorting the results, the results are sorted by relevance.
If you don't provide sorting configuration, the results are sorted by the relevance that Amazon Kendra determines for the result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.UserContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserContext.
The user context token or user and group information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.VisitorId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VisitorId.
Provides an identifier for a specific user. The VisitorId should be a unique identifier, such as a GUID. Don't use personally identifiable information, such as the user's email address, as the VisitorId.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the Query operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.FacetResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FacetResults.
Contains the facet results. A FacetResult contains the counts for each attribute key that was specified in the Facets input parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.QueryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryId.
The unique identifier for the search. You use QueryId to identify the search when using the feedback API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.ResultItems
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResultItems.
The results of the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.TotalNumberOfResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalNumberOfResults.
The total number of items found by the search; however, you can only retrieve up to 100 items. For example, if the search found 192 items, you can only retrieve the first 100 of the items.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem
member.summary:
A single query result.
A query result contains information about a document returned by the query. This includes the original location of the document, a list of attributes assigned to the document, and relevant text from the document that satisfies the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.AdditionalAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalAttributes.
One or more additional attributes associated with the query result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributes.
An array of document attributes for the document that the query result maps to. For example, the document author (Author) or the source URI (SourceUri) of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentExcerpt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentExcerpt.
An extract of the text in the document. Contains information about highlighting the relevant terms in the excerpt.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The unique identifier for the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentTitle.
The title of the document. Contains the text of the title and information for highlighting the relevant terms in the title.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentURI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentURI.
The URI of the original location of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.FeedbackToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackToken.
A token that identifies a particular result from a particular query. Use this token to provide click-through feedback for the result. For more information, see Submitting feedback .

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the query result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.ScoreAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScoreAttributes.
Indicates the confidence that Amazon Kendra has that a result matches the query that you provided. Each result is placed into a bin that indicates the confidence, VERY_HIGH, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW. You can use the score to determine if a response meets the confidence needed for your application.
The field is only set to LOW when the Type field is set to DOCUMENT and Amazon Kendra is not confident that the result matches the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary
member.summary:
Summary information on a query suggestions block list.
This includes information on the block list ID, block list name, when the block list was created, when the block list was last updated, and the count of block words/phrases in the block list.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
