The date-time summary information for a query suggestions block list was last created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.ItemCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemCount.
The number of items in the block list file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The date-time the block list was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance
member.summary: Provides information for manually tuning the relevance of a field in a search. When a query includes terms that match the field, the results are given a boost in the response based on these tuning parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Duration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Duration.
Specifies the time period that the boost applies to. For example, to make the boost apply to documents with the field value within the last month, you would use "2628000s". Once the field value is beyond the specified range, the effect of the boost drops off. The higher the importance, the faster the effect drops off. If you don't specify a value, the default is 3 months. The value of the field is a numeric string followed by the character "s", for example "86400s" for one day, or "604800s" for one week.
Only applies to DATE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Freshness
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Freshness.
Indicates that this field determines how "fresh" a document is. For example, if document 1 was created on November 5, and document 2 was created on October 31, document 1 is "fresher" than document 2. You can only set the Freshness field on one DATE type field. Only applies to DATE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Importance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Importance.
The relative importance of the field in the search. Larger numbers provide more of a boost than smaller numbers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.RankOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RankOrder.
Determines how values should be interpreted.
When the RankOrder field is ASCENDING, higher numbers are better. For example, a document with a rating score of 10 is higher ranking than a document with a rating score of 1.
When the RankOrder field is DESCENDING, lower numbers are better. For example, in a task tracking application, a priority 1 task is more important than a priority 5 task.
Only applies to LONG and DOUBLE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.ValueImportanceMap
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValueImportanceMap.
A list of values that should be given a different boost when they appear in the result list. For example, if you are boosting a field called "department," query terms that match the department field are boosted in the result. However, you can add entries from the department field to boost documents with those values higher.
For example, you can add entries to the map with names of departments. If you add "HR",5 and "Legal",3 those departments are given special attention when they appear in the metadata of a document. When those terms appear they are given the specified importance instead of the regular importance for the boost.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback
member.summary: Provides feedback on how relevant a document is to a search. Your application uses the SubmitFeedback operation to provide relevance information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback.RelevanceValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelevanceValue.
Whether to document was relevant or not relevant to the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback.ResultId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResultId.
The unique identifier of the search result that the user provided relevance feedback for.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for a data source to index documents in an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.AccessControlListConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessControlListConfiguration.
Provides the path to the S3 bucket that contains the user context filtering files for the data source. For the format of the file, see Access control for S3 data sources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
The name of the bucket that contains the documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.DocumentsMetadataConfiguration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DocumentsMetadataConfiguration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of glob patterns for documents that should not be indexed. If a document that matches an inclusion prefix or inclusion pattern also matches an exclusion pattern, the document is not indexed.
Some examples are:
*.png , *.jpg will exclude all PNG and JPEG image files in a directory (files with the extensions .png and .jpg).
*internal* will exclude all files in a directory that contain 'internal' in the file name, such as 'internal', 'internal_only', 'company_internal'.
**/*internal* will exclude all internal-related files in a directory and its subdirectories.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of glob patterns for documents that should be indexed. If a document that matches an inclusion pattern also matches an exclusion pattern, the document is not indexed.
Some examples are:
*.txt will include all text files in a directory (files with the extension .txt).
**/*.txt will include all text files in a directory and its subdirectories.
*tax* will include all files in a directory that contain 'tax' in the file name, such as 'tax', 'taxes', 'income_tax'.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3DataSourceConfiguration.InclusionPrefixes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPrefixes.
A list of S3 prefixes for the documents that should be included in the index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3Path
member.summary: Information required to find a specific file in an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3Path.Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bucket.
The name of the S3 bucket that contains the file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.S3Path.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The name of the file.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceChatterFeedConfiguration
member.summary: Defines configuration for syncing a Salesforce chatter feed. The contents of the object comes from the Salesforce FeedItem table.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceChatterFeedConfiguration.DocumentDataFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentDataFieldName.
The name of the column in the Salesforce FeedItem table that contains the content to index. Typically this is the Body column.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceChatterFeedConfiguration.DocumentTitleFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentTitleFieldName.
The name of the column in the Salesforce FeedItem table that contains the title of the document. This is typically the Title column.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceChatterFeedConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
Maps fields from a Salesforce chatter feed into Amazon Kendra index fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceChatterFeedConfiguration.IncludeFilterTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeFilterTypes.
Filters the documents in the feed based on status of the user. When you specify ACTIVE_USERS only documents from users who have an active account are indexed. When you specify STANDARD_USER only documents for Salesforce standard users are documented. You can specify both.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for connecting to a Salesforce data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.ChatterFeedConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChatterFeedConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for Salesforce chatter feeds.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.CrawlAttachments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlAttachments.
Indicates whether Amazon Kendra should index attachments to Salesforce objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the name of the attached file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the name of the attached file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.KnowledgeArticleConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KnowledgeArticleConfiguration.
Specifies configuration information for the knowledge article types that Amazon Kendra indexes. Amazon Kendra indexes standard knowledge articles and the standard fields of knowledge articles, or the custom fields of custom knowledge articles, but not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the key/value pairs required to connect to your Salesforce instance. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
authenticationUrl - The OAUTH endpoint that Amazon Kendra connects to get an OAUTH token.
consumerKey - The application public key generated when you created your Salesforce application.
consumerSecret - The application private key generated when you created your Salesforce application.
password - The password associated with the user logging in to the Salesforce instance.
securityToken - The token associated with the user account logging in to the Salesforce instance.
username - The user name of the user logging in to the Salesforce instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.ServerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerUrl.
The instance URL for the Salesforce site that you want to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.StandardObjectAttachmentConfiguration
member.summary:

Provides configuration information for processing attachments to Salesforce standard objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceConfiguration.StandardObjectConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StandardObjectConfigurations.
Specifies the Salesforce standard objects that Amazon Kendra indexes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceCustomKnowledgeArticleTypeConfiguration.DocumentTitleFieldName
member.summary:

member.summary:

The name of the configuration.

member.summary: Specifies configuration information for the knowledge article types that Amazon Kendra indexes. Amazon Kendra indexes standard knowledge articles and the standard fields of knowledge articles, or the custom fields of custom knowledge articles, but not both

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.CustomKnowledgeArticleTypeConfigurations
member.summary:

Provides configuration information for custom Salesforce knowledge articles.

Provides configuration information for standard Salesforce knowledge articles.

member.summary: Provides configuration information for standard Salesforce knowledge articles.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceStandardKnowledgeArticleTypeConfiguration.DocumentDataFieldName
member.summary:

The name of the field that contains the document data to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SalesforceStandardKnowledgeArticleTypeConfiguration.DocumentTitleFieldName

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ScoreAttributes
member.summary: Provides a relative ranking that indicates how confident Amazon Kendra is that the response matches the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ScoreAttributes.ScoreConfidence
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScoreConfidence.
A relative ranking for how well the response matches the query.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Search
member.summary: Provides information about how a custom index field is used during a search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Search.Displayable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Displayable.
Determines whether the field is returned in the query response. The default is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Search.Facetable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Facetable.
Indicates that the field can be used to create search facets, a count of results for each value in the field. The default is false .

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Search.Searchable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Searchable.
Determines whether the field is used in the search. If the Searchable field is true, you can use relevance tuning to manually tune how Amazon Kendra weights the field in the search. The default is true for string fields and false for number and date fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Search.Sortable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sortable.
Determines whether the field can be used to sort the results of a query. If you specify sorting on a field that does not have Sortable set to true, Amazon Kendra returns an exception. The default is false.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SeedUrlConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information of the seed or starting point URLs to crawl.
When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the Amazon Acceptable Use Policy and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use the Amazon Kendra web crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SeedUrlConfiguration.SeedUrls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SeedUrls.
The list of seed or starting point URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
The list can include a maximum of 100 seed URLs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SeedUrlConfiguration.WebCrawlerMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebCrawlerMode.
You can choose one of the following modes:
HOST_ONLY crawl only the website host names. For example, if the seed URL is "abc.example.com", then only URLs with host name "abc.example.com" are crawled.
SUBDOMAINS crawl the website host names with subdomains. For example, if the seed URL is "abc.example.com", then "a.abc.example.com" and "b.abc.example.com" are also crawled.
EVERYTHING crawl the website host names with subdomains and other domains that the webpages link to.
The default mode is set to HOST_ONLY.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the identifier of the KMScustomer master key (CMK) used to encrypt data indexed by Amazon Kendra. Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric CMKs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration.KmsKeyId
member.summary:

The identifier of the KMScustomer master key (CMK). Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric CMKs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information required to connect to a ServiceNow data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
Determines the type of authentication used to connect to the ServiceNow instance. If you choose HTTP_BASIC, Amazon Kendra is authenticated using the user name and password provided in the AWS Secrets Manager secret in the SecretArn field. When you choose OAUTH2, Amazon Kendra is authenticated using the OAuth token and secret provided in the Secrets Manager secret, and the user name and password are used to determine which information Amazon Kendra has access to.
When you use OAUTH2 authentication, you must generate a token and a client secret using the ServiceNow console. For more information, see Using a ServiceNow data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.HostUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostUrl.
The ServiceNow instance that the data source connects to. The host endpoint should look like the following: {instance}.service-now.com.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.KnowledgeArticleConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KnowledgeArticleConfiguration.
Provides configuration information for crawling knowledge articles in the ServiceNow site.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Secrets Manager secret that contains the user name and password required to connect to the ServiceNow instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.ServiceCatalogConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceCatalogConfiguration.
Provides configuration information for crawling service catalogs in the ServiceNow site.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowConfiguration.ServiceNowBuildVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceNowBuildVersion.
The identifier of the release that the ServiceNow host is running. If the host is not running the LONDON release, use OTHERS.

member.summary:

The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document contents field in the Amazon Kendra index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.DocumentTitleFieldName
member.summary:

The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document title field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
List of regular expressions applied to knowledge articles. Items that don't match the inclusion pattern are not indexed. The regex is applied to the field specified in the PatternTargetField

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
Mapping between ServiceNow fields and Amazon Kendra index fields. You must create the index field before you map the field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.FilterQuery
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterQuery.
A query that selects the knowledge articles to index. The query can return articles from multiple knowledge bases, and the knowledge bases can be public or private.
The query string must be one generated by the ServiceNow console. For more information, see Specifying documents to index with a query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowKnowledgeArticleConfiguration.IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
List of regular expressions applied to knowledge articles. Items that don't match the inclusion pattern are not indexed. The regex is applied to the field specified in the PatternTargetField.

member.summary:

The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document contents field in the Amazon Kendra index.

member.summary:

The name of the ServiceNow field that is mapped to the index document title field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowServiceCatalogConfiguration.ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the file name of the attachment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowServiceCatalogConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
Mapping between ServiceNow fields and Amazon Kendra index fields. You must create the index field before you map the field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ServiceNowServiceCatalogConfiguration.IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeAttachmentFilePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the file name of the attachment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for connecting to a Microsoft SharePoint data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.CrawlAttachments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlAttachments.
TRUE to include attachments to documents stored in your Microsoft SharePoint site in the index; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.DisableLocalGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisableLocalGroups.
A Boolean value that specifies whether local groups are disabled (True) or enabled (False).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.DocumentTitleFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentTitleFieldName.
The Microsoft SharePoint attribute field that contains the title of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an exclusion pattern and an inclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the display URL of the SharePoint document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map Microsoft SharePoint attributes to custom fields in the Amazon Kendra index. You must first create the index fields using the UpdateIndex operation before you map SharePoint attributes. For more information, see Mapping Data Source Fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the document is not included in the index.
The regex is applied to the display URL of the SharePoint document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of credentials stored in Secrets Manager. The credentials should be a user/password pair. If you use SharePoint Server, you also need to provide the sever domain name as part of the credentials. For more information, see Using a Microsoft SharePoint Data Source. For more information about Secrets Manager, see What Is Secrets Manager in the Secrets Manager user guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.SharePointVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SharePointVersion.
The version of Microsoft SharePoint that you are using as a data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.SslCertificateS3Path
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SslCertificateS3Path.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.Urls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Urls.
The URLs of the Microsoft SharePoint site that contains the documents that should be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.UseChangeLog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseChangeLog.
Set to TRUE to use the Microsoft SharePoint change log to determine the documents that need to be updated in the index. Depending on the size of the SharePoint change log, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than it takes it to determine the changed documents using the Amazon Kendra document crawler.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SharePointConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SiteMapsConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information of the sitemap URLs to crawl.
When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the Amazon Acceptable Use Policy and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use the Amazon Kendra web crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SiteMapsConfiguration.SiteMaps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SiteMaps.
The list of sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
The list can include a maximum of three sitemap URLs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SortingConfiguration
member.summary:
Specifies the document attribute to use to sort the response to a Amazon Kendra query. You can specify a single attribute for sorting. The attribute must have the Sortable flag set to true, otherwise Amazon Kendra returns an exception.
You can sort attributes of the following types.
Date value
Long value
String value
You can't sort attributes of the following type.
String list value

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SortingConfiguration.DocumentAttributeKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeKey.
The name of the document attribute used to sort the response. You can use any field that has the Sortable flag set to true.
You can also sort by any of the following built-in attributes:
_category
_created_at
_last_updated_at
_version
_view_count

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SortingConfiguration.SortOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortOrder.
The order that the results should be returned in. In case of ties, the relevance assigned to the result by Amazon Kendra is used as the tie-breaker.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SqlConfiguration
member.summary: Provides information that configures Amazon Kendra to use a SQL database.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.SqlConfiguration.QueryIdentifiersEnclosingOption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryIdentifiersEnclosingOption.
Determines whether Amazon Kendra encloses SQL identifiers for tables and column names in double quotes (") when making a database query.
By default, Amazon Kendra passes SQL identifiers the way that they are entered into the data source configuration. It does not change the case of identifiers or enclose them in quotes.
PostgreSQL internally converts uppercase characters to lower case characters in identifiers unless they are quoted. Choosing this option encloses identifiers in quotes so that PostgreSQL does not convert the character's case.
For MySQL databases, you must enable the ansi_quotes option when you set this field to DOUBLE_QUOTES.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation. Updates a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
Updates to a block list might not take effect right away. Amazon Kendra needs to refresh the entire suggestions list to apply any updates to the block list. Other changes not related to the block list apply immediately.
If a block list is updating, then you need to wait for the first update to finish before submitting another update.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description for a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier of a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The IAM (Identity and Access Management) role used to access the block list text file in S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.SourceS3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceS3Path.
The S3 path where your block list text file sits in S3.
If you update your block list and provide the same path to the block list text file in S3, then Amazon Kendra reloads the file to refresh the block list. Amazon Kendra does not automatically refresh your block list. You need to call the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList API to refresh you block list.
If you update your block list, then Amazon Kendra asynchronously refreshes all query suggestions with the latest content in the S3 file. This means changes might not take effect immediately.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig operation. Updates the settings of query suggestions for an index.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
If an update is currently processing (i.e. 'happening'), you need to wait for the update to finish before making another update.
Updates to query suggestions settings might not take effect right away. The time for your updated settings to take effect depends on the updates made and the number of search queries in your index.
You can still enable/disable query suggestions at any time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.IncludeQueriesWithoutUserInformation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeQueriesWithoutUserInformation.
TRUE to include queries without user information (i.e. all queries, irrespective of the user), otherwise FALSE to only include queries with user information.
If you pass user information to Amazon Kendra along with the queries, you can set this flag to FALSE and instruct Amazon Kendra to only consider queries with user information.
If you set to FALSE, Amazon Kendra only considers queries searched at least MinimumQueryCount times across MinimumNumberOfQueryingUsers unique users for suggestions.
If you set to TRUE, Amazon Kendra ignores all user information and learns from all queries.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to update query suggestions settings for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.MinimumNumberOfQueryingUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumNumberOfQueryingUsers.
The minimum number of unique users who must search a query in order for the query to be eligible to suggest to your users.
Increasing this number might decrease the number of suggestions. However, this ensures a query is searched by many users and is truly popular to suggest to users.
How you tune this setting depends on your specific needs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.MinimumQueryCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumQueryCount.
The the minimum number of times a query must be searched in order to be eligible to suggest to your users.
Decreasing this number increases the number of suggestions. However, this affects the quality of suggestions as it sets a low bar for a query to be considered popular to suggest to users.
How you tune this setting depends on your specific needs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Set the mode to ENABLED or LEARN_ONLY.
By default, Amazon Kendra enables query suggestions. LEARN_ONLY mode allows you to turn off query suggestions. You can to update this at any time.
In LEARN_ONLY mode, Amazon Kendra continues to learn from new queries to keep suggestions up to date for when you are ready to switch to ENABLED mode again.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.QueryLogLookBackWindowInDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryLogLookBackWindowInDays.
How recent your queries are in your query log time window.
The time window is the number of days from current day to past days.
By default, Amazon Kendra sets this to 180.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Urls
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information of the URLs to crawl.
You can only crawl websites that use the secure communication protocol, Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). If you receive an error when crawling a website, it could be that the website is blocked from crawling.
When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the Amazon Acceptable Use Policy and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use the Amazon Kendra web crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Urls.SeedUrlConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SeedUrlConfiguration.
Provides the configuration of the seed or starting point URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
You can choose to crawl only the website host names, or the website host names with subdomains, or the website host names with subdomains and other domains that the webpages link to.
You can list up to 100 seed URLs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Urls.SiteMapsConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SiteMapsConfiguration.
Provides the configuration of the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
Only URLs belonging to the same website host names are crawled. You can list up to three sitemap URLs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserContext
member.summary:
Provides information about the user context for an Amazon Kendra index.
This is used for filtering search results for different users based on their access to documents.
You provide one of the following:
User token
User ID, the groups the user belongs to, and any data sources the groups can access.
If you provide both, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserContext.DataSourceGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceGroups.
The list of data source groups you want to filter search results based on groups' access to documents in that data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserContext.Groups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Groups.
The list of groups you want to filter search results based on the groups' access to documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserContext.Token
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Token.
The user context token for filtering search results for a user. It must be a JWT or a JSON token.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserContext.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The identifier of the user you want to filter search results based on their access to documents.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserGroupResolutionConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information to fetch access levels of groups and users from an AWS Single Sign-On identity source. This is useful for setting up user context filtering, where Amazon Kendra filters search results for different users based on their group's access to documents. You can also map your users to their groups for user context filtering using the PutPrincipalMapping operation.
To set up an AWS SSO identity source in the console to use with Amazon Kendra, see Getting started with an AWS SSO identity source. You must also grant the required permissions to use AWS SSO with Amazon Kendra. For more information, see IAM roles for AWS Single Sign-On.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserGroupResolutionConfiguration.UserGroupResolutionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserGroupResolutionMode.
The identity store provider (mode) you want to use to fetch access levels of groups and users. AWS Single Sign-On is currently the only available mode. Your users and groups must exist in an AWS SSO identity source in order to use this mode.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserTokenConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration information for a token configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserTokenConfiguration.JsonTokenTypeConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JsonTokenTypeConfiguration.
Information about the JSON token type configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.UserTokenConfiguration.JwtTokenTypeConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JwtTokenTypeConfiguration.
Information about the JWT token type configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information required for Amazon Kendra web crawler.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.AuthenticationConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationConfiguration.
Provides configuration information required to connect to websites using authentication.
You can connect to websites using basic authentication of user name and password.
You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of https://a.example.com/page1.html is "a.example.com" and the port is 443, the standard port for HTTPS. You use a secret in AWS Secrets Manager to store your authentication credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.CrawlDepth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlDepth.
Specifies the number of levels in a website that you want to crawl.
The first level begins from the website seed or starting point URL. For example, if a website has 3 levels index level (i.e. seed in this example), sections level, and subsections level and you are only interested in crawling information up to the sections level (i.e. levels 0-1), you can set your depth to 1.
The default crawl depth is set to 2.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.MaxContentSizePerPageInMegaBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxContentSizePerPageInMegaBytes.
The maximum size (in MB) of a webpage or attachment to crawl.
Files larger than this size (in MB) are skipped/not crawled.
The default maximum size of a webpage or attachment is set to 50 MB.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.MaxLinksPerPage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxLinksPerPage.
The maximum number of URLs on a webpage to include when crawling a website. This number is per webpage.
As a websites webpages are crawled, any URLs the webpages link to are also crawled. URLs on a webpage are crawled in order of appearance.
The default maximum links per page is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.MaxUrlsPerMinuteCrawlRate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxUrlsPerMinuteCrawlRate.
The maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute.
A minimum of one URL is required.
The default maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute is 300.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.ProxyConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProxyConfiguration.
Provides configuration information required to connect to your internal websites via a web proxy.
You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of https://a.example.com/page1.html is "a.example.com" and the port is 443, the standard port for HTTPS.
Web proxy credentials are optional and you can use them to connect to a web proxy server that requires basic authentication. To store web proxy credentials, you use a secret in AWS Secrets Manager.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.UrlExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UrlExclusionPatterns.
The regular expression pattern to exclude certain URLs to crawl.
If there is a regular expression pattern to include certain URLs that conflicts with the exclude pattern, the exclude pattern takes precedence.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.UrlInclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UrlInclusionPatterns.
The regular expression pattern to include certain URLs to crawl.
If there is a regular expression pattern to exclude certain URLs that conflicts with the include pattern, the exclude pattern takes precedence.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WebCrawlerConfiguration.Urls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Urls.
Specifies the seed or starting point URLs of the websites or the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl.
You can include website subdomains. You can list up to 100 seed URLs and up to three sitemap URLs.
You can only crawl websites that use the secure communication protocol, Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). If you receive an error when crawling a website, it could be that the website is blocked from crawling.
When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the Amazon Acceptable Use Policy and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use the Amazon Kendra web crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information to connect to Amazon WorkDocs as your data source.
Amazon WorkDocs connector is available in Oregon, North Virginia, Sydney, Singapore and Ireland regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.CrawlComments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlComments.
TRUE to include comments on documents in your index. Including comments in your index means each comment is a document that can be searched on.
The default is set to FALSE.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Amazon WorkDocs site repository. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that dont match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isnt included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map Amazon WorkDocs field names to custom index field names in Amazon Kendra. You must first create the custom index fields using the UpdateIndex operation before you map to Amazon WorkDocs fields. For more information, see Mapping Data Source Fields. The Amazon WorkDocs data source field names need to exist in your Amazon WorkDocs custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Amazon WorkDocs site repository. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isnt included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.OrganizationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationId.
The identifier of the directory corresponding to your Amazon WorkDocs site repository.
You can find the organization ID in the AWS Directory Service by going to Active Directory, then Directories. Your Amazon WorkDocs site directory has an ID, which is the organization ID. You can also set up a new Amazon WorkDocs directory in the AWS Directory Service console and enable a Amazon WorkDocs site for the directory in the Amazon WorkDocs console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.WorkDocsConfiguration.UseChangeLog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseChangeLog.
TRUE to use the change logs to update documents in your index instead of scanning all documents.
If you are syncing your Amazon WorkDocs data source with your index for the first time, all documents are scanned. After your first sync, you can use the change logs to update your documents in your index for future syncs.
The default is set to FALSE.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Kendra
Amazon Kendra is a service for indexing large document sets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonKendraClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.BatchDeleteDocument(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest)
member.summary:
Removes one or more documents from an index. The documents must have been added with the BatchPutDocument operation.
The documents are deleted asynchronously. You can see the progress of the deletion by using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to the processing of the batch are sent to you CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteDocument service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchDeleteDocument Operation

member.summary:

The documents are deleted asynchronously. You can see the progress of the deletion by using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to the processing of the batch are sent to you CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteDocument service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchDeleteDocument Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.BatchGetDocumentStatus(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the indexing status for one or more documents submitted with the BatchPutDocument operation.
When you use the BatchPutDocument operation, documents are indexed asynchronously. You can use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to get the current status of a list of documents so that you can determine if they have been successfully indexed.
You can also use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to check the status of the BatchDeleteDocument operation. When a document is deleted from the index, Amazon Kendra returns NOT_FOUND as the status.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchGetDocumentStatus Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.BatchGetDocumentStatusAsync(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Returns the indexing status for one or more documents submitted with the BatchPutDocument operation.
When you use the BatchPutDocument operation, documents are indexed asynchronously. You can use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to get the current status of a list of documents so that you can determine if they have been successfully indexed.
You can also use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to check the status of the BatchDeleteDocument operation. When a document is deleted from the index, Amazon Kendra returns NOT_FOUND as the status.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchGetDocumentStatus Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.BatchPutDocument(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest)
member.summary:
Adds one or more documents to an index.
The BatchPutDocument operation enables you to ingest inline documents or a set of documents stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use this operation to ingest your text and unstructured text into an index, add custom attributes to the documents, and to attach an access control list to the documents added to the index.
The documents are indexed asynchronously. You can see the progress of the batch using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to processing the batch are sent to your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchPutDocument service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchPutDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchPutDocument Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.BatchPutDocumentAsync(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:

Use this operation to ingest your text and unstructured text into an index, add custom attributes to the documents, and to attach an access control list to the documents added to the index.
The documents are indexed asynchronously. You can see the progress of the batch using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to processing the batch are sent to your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchPutDocument service method.

member.returns: The response from the BatchPutDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchPutDocument Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.ClearQuerySuggestions(Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClearQuerySuggestionsRequest)
member.summary:
Clears existing query suggestions from an index.
This deletes existing suggestions only, not the queries in the query log. After you clear suggestions, Amazon Kendra learns new suggestions based on new queries added to the query log from the time you cleared suggestions. If you do not see any new suggestions, then please allow Amazon Kendra to collect enough queries to learn new suggestions.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ClearQuerySuggestions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ClearQuerySuggestions service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ClearQuerySuggestions Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.CreateDataSource(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a data source that you want to use with an Amazon Kendra index.
You specify a name, data source connector type and description for your data source. You also specify configuration information for the data source connector.
CreateDataSource is a synchronous operation. The operation returns 200 if the data source was successfully created. Otherwise, an exception is raised.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateDataSource service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateDataSource service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateDataSource Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.CreateIndex(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a new Amazon Kendra index. Index creation is an asynchronous operation. To determine if index creation has completed, check the Status field returned from a call to DescribeIndex. The Status field is set to ACTIVE when the index is ready to use.
Once the index is active you can index your documents using the BatchPutDocument operation or using one of the supported data sources.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateIndex service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateIndex service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateIndex Operation

Once the index is active you can index your documents using the BatchPutDocument operation or using one of the supported data sources.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a block list to exlcude certain queries from suggestions.
Any query that contains words or phrases specified in the block list is blocked or filtered out from being shown as a suggestion.
You need to provide the file location of your block list text file in your S3 bucket. In your text file, enter each block word or phrase on a separate line.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.DeletePrincipalMapping(Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a group so that all users and sub groups that belong to the group can no longer access documents only available to that group.
For example, after deleting the group "Summer Interns", all interns who belonged to that group no longer see intern-only documents in their search results.
If you want to delete or replace users or sub groups of a group, you need to use the PutPrincipalMapping operation. For example, if a user in the group "Engineering" leaves the engineering team and another user takes their place, you provide an updated list of users or sub groups that belong to the "Engineering" group when calling PutPrincipalMapping. You can update your internal list of users or sub groups and input this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeletePrincipalMapping service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeletePrincipalMapping service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeletePrincipalMapping Operation

You can update your internal list of users or sub groups and input this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeletePrincipalMapping service method.

member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeletePrincipalMapping Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.PutPrincipalMapping(Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest)
member.summary:
Maps users to their groups so that you only need to provide the user ID when you issue the query.
You can also map sub groups to groups. For example, the group "Company Intellectual Property Teams" includes sub groups "Research" and "Engineering". These sub groups include their own list of users or people who work in these teams. Only users who work in research and engineering, and therefore belong in the intellectual property group, can see top-secret company documents in their search results.
You map users to their groups when you want to filter search results for different users based on their groups access to documents. For more information on filtering search results for different users, see Filtering on user context.
If more than five PUT actions for a group are currently processing, a validation exception is thrown.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutPrincipalMapping service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutPrincipalMapping service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutPrincipalMapping Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.PutPrincipalMappingAsync(Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:

These sub groups include their own list of users or people who work in these teams. Only users who work in research and engineering, and therefore belong in the intellectual property group, can see top-secret company documents in their search results.
You map users to their groups when you want to filter search results for different users based on their groups access to documents. For more information on filtering search results for different users, see Filtering on user context.
If more than five PUT actions for a group are currently processing, a validation exception is thrown.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutPrincipalMapping service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the PutPrincipalMapping service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutPrincipalMapping Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.Query(Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest)
member.summary:
Searches an active index. Use this API to search your documents using query. The Query operation enables to do faceted search and to filter results based on document attributes.
It also enables you to provide user context that Amazon Kendra uses to enforce document access control in the search results.
Amazon Kendra searches your index for text content and question and answer (FAQ) content. By default the response contains three types of results.
Relevant passages
Matching FAQs
Relevant documents
You can specify that the query return only one type of result using the QueryResultTypeConfig parameter.
Each query returns the 100 most relevant results.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the Query service method.
member.returns: The response from the Query service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for Query Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList(Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest)
member.summary:
Updates a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
Updates to a block list might not take effect right away. Amazon Kendra needs to refresh the entire suggestions list to apply any updates to the block list. Other changes not related to the block list apply immediately.
If a block list is updating, then you need to wait for the first update to finish before submitting another update.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList Operation

If a block list is updating, then you need to wait for the first update to finish before submitting another update.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.AmazonKendraClient.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig(Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest)
member.summary:
Updates the settings of query suggestions for an index.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
If an update is currently processing (i.e. 'happening'), you need to wait for the update to finish before making another update.
Updates to query suggestions settings might not take effect right away. The time for your updated settings to take effect depends on the updates made and the number of search queries in your index.
You can still enable/disable query suggestions at any time.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig Operation

Updates to query suggestions settings might not take effect right away. The time for your updated settings to take effect depends on the updates made and the number of search queries in your index.
You can still enable/disable query suggestions at any time.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.BatchDeleteDocument(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchDeleteDocumentRequest)
member.summary:
Removes one or more documents from an index. The documents must have been added with the BatchPutDocument operation.
The documents are deleted asynchronously. You can see the progress of the deletion by using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to the processing of the batch are sent to you CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteDocument service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchDeleteDocument Operation

member.summary:
Removes one or more documents from an index. The documents must have been added with the BatchPutDocument operation.
The documents are deleted asynchronously. You can see the progress of the deletion by using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to the processing of the batch are sent to you CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchDeleteDocument service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchDeleteDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchDeleteDocument Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.BatchGetDocumentStatus(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the indexing status for one or more documents submitted with the BatchPutDocument operation.
When you use the BatchPutDocument operation, documents are indexed asynchronously. You can use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to get the current status of a list of documents so that you can determine if they have been successfully indexed.
You can also use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to check the status of the BatchDeleteDocument operation. When a document is deleted from the index, Amazon Kendra returns NOT_FOUND as the status.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchGetDocumentStatus Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.BatchGetDocumentStatusAsync(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchGetDocumentStatusRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Returns the indexing status for one or more documents submitted with the BatchPutDocument operation.
When you use the BatchPutDocument operation, documents are indexed asynchronously. You can use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to get the current status of a list of documents so that you can determine if they have been successfully indexed.
You can also use the BatchGetDocumentStatus operation to check the status of the BatchDeleteDocument operation. When a document is deleted from the index, Amazon Kendra returns NOT_FOUND as the status.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchGetDocumentStatus service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchGetDocumentStatus Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.BatchPutDocument(Amazon.Kendra.Model.BatchPutDocumentRequest)
member.summary:
Adds one or more documents to an index.
The BatchPutDocument operation enables you to ingest inline documents or a set of documents stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use this operation to ingest your text and unstructured text into an index, add custom attributes to the documents, and to attach an access control list to the documents added to the index.
The documents are indexed asynchronously. You can see the progress of the batch using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to processing the batch are sent to your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchPutDocument service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchPutDocument service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchPutDocument Operation

Adds one or more documents to an index.
The BatchPutDocument operation enables you to ingest inline documents or a set of documents stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use this operation to ingest your text and unstructured text into an index, add custom attributes to the documents, and to attach an access control list to the documents added to the index.
The documents are indexed asynchronously. You can see the progress of the batch using Amazon Web Services CloudWatch. Any error messages related to processing the batch are sent to your Amazon Web Services CloudWatch log.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.ClearQuerySuggestions(Amazon.Kendra.Model.ClearQuerySuggestionsRequest)
member.summary:
Clears existing query suggestions from an index.
This deletes existing suggestions only, not the queries in the query log. After you clear suggestions, Amazon Kendra learns new suggestions based on new queries added to the query log from the time you cleared suggestions. If you do not see any new suggestions, then please allow Amazon Kendra to collect enough queries to learn new suggestions.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ClearQuerySuggestions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ClearQuerySuggestions service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ClearQuerySuggestions Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.CreateDataSource(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateDataSourceRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a data source that you want to use with an Amazon Kendra index.
You specify a name, data source connector type and description for your data source. You also specify configuration information for the data source connector.
CreateDataSource is a synchronous operation. The operation returns 200 if the data source was successfully created. Otherwise, an exception is raised.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateDataSource service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateDataSource service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateDataSource Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.CreateIndex(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateIndexRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a new Amazon Kendra index. Index creation is an asynchronous operation. To determine if index creation has completed, check the Status field returned from a call to DescribeIndex. The Status field is set to ACTIVE when the index is ready to use.
Once the index is active you can index your documents using the BatchPutDocument operation or using one of the supported data sources.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateIndex service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateIndex service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateIndex Operation

Once the index is active you can index your documents using the BatchPutDocument operation or using one of the supported data sources.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList(Amazon.Kendra.Model.CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a block list to exlcude certain queries from suggestions.
Any query that contains words or phrases specified in the block list is blocked or filtered out from being shown as a suggestion.
You need to provide the file location of your block list text file in your S3 bucket. In your text file, enter each block word or phrase on a separate line.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateQuerySuggestionsBlockList Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.DeletePrincipalMapping(Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a group so that all users and sub groups that belong to the group can no longer access documents only available to that group.
For example, after deleting the group "Summer Interns", all interns who belonged to that group no longer see intern-only documents in their search results.
If you want to delete or replace users or sub groups of a group, you need to use the PutPrincipalMapping operation. For example, if a user in the group "Engineering" leaves the engineering team and another user takes their place, you provide an updated list of users or sub groups that belong to the "Engineering" group when calling PutPrincipalMapping. You can update your internal list of users or sub groups and input this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeletePrincipalMapping service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeletePrincipalMapping service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeletePrincipalMapping Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.PutPrincipalMapping(Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest)
member.summary:
Maps users to their groups so that you only need to provide the user ID when you issue the query.
You can also map sub groups to groups. For example, the group "Company Intellectual Property Teams" includes sub groups "Research" and "Engineering". These sub groups include their own list of users or people who work in these teams. Only users who work in research and engineering, and therefore belong in the intellectual property group, can see top-secret company documents in their search results.
You map users to their groups when you want to filter search results for different users based on their groups access to documents. For more information on filtering search results for different users, see Filtering on user context.
If more than five PUT actions for a group are currently processing, a validation exception is thrown.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutPrincipalMapping service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutPrincipalMapping service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutPrincipalMapping Operation

You map users to their groups when you want to filter search results for different users based on their groups access to documents. For more information on filtering search results for different users, see Filtering on user context.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.Query(Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest)
member.summary:
Searches an active index. Use this API to search your documents using query. The Query operation enables to do faceted search and to filter results based on document attributes.
It also enables you to provide user context that Amazon Kendra uses to enforce document access control in the search results.
Amazon Kendra searches your index for text content and question and answer (FAQ) content. By default the response contains three types of results.
Relevant passages
Matching FAQs
Relevant documents
You can specify that the query return only one type of result using the QueryResultTypeConfig parameter.
Each query returns the 100 most relevant results.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the Query service method.
member.returns: The response from the Query service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for Query Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList(Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest)
member.summary:
Updates a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
Updates to a block list might not take effect right away. Amazon Kendra needs to refresh the entire suggestions list to apply any updates to the block list. Other changes not related to the block list apply immediately.
If a block list is updating, then you need to wait for the first update to finish before submitting another update.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList Operation

Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsBlockList service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.name: M:Amazon.Kendra.IAmazonKendra.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig(Amazon.Kendra.Model.UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest)
member.summary:
Updates the settings of query suggestions for an index.
Amazon Kendra supports partial updates, so you only need to provide the fields you want to update.
If an update is currently processing (i.e. 'happening'), you need to wait for the update to finish before making another update.
Updates to query suggestions settings might not take effect right away. The time for your updated settings to take effect depends on the updates made and the number of search queries in your index.
You can still enable/disable query suggestions at any time.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method, as returned by Kendra.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig Operation

Updates to query suggestions settings might not take effect right away. The time for your updated settings to take effect depends on the updates made and the number of search queries in your index.
You can still enable/disable query suggestions at any time.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig service method.
